question: I just had a cardiac calcium scan, resulting in a test score of 1,284 (!)I am 74 years old, and lack any of the usual markers for heart disease---no family history, non-smoker, normal weight, no diabetes, physically veryactive, cholesterol readings at high end of acceptable ranges.  I have nohistory of heart problems (but do have a pacemaker to control arrhythmia.)Could this scan result be a false positive?  What do you suggest I do?Thank you!
title: Calcium cardiac scan problem
